meanings.definition: A humorous imitation or parody of something.
meanings.sent1: The comedy show featured a hilarious sendup of popular movies.
meanings.sent2: The sendup of the famous singer's mannerisms had the audience in stitches.
meanings.sent3: The sendup of the president's speech was so funny, even he couldn't help but laugh.
meanings.sent4: Her sendup of the teacher's strict rules was both clever and entertaining.
meanings.sent5: The sendup of the superhero's costume was so spot-on, it became a viral sensation.

meanings.definition: To mock or make fun of something through imitation.
meanings.sent1: The comedian decided to sendup the politician's speech for a good laugh.
meanings.sent2: She always had a knack for sendup, making even serious topics seem light-hearted.
meanings.sent3: The group of friends would often sendup each other's quirks in a playful way.
meanings.sent4: His sendup of the boss's strict demeanor was a hit among his colleagues.
meanings.sent5: The students decided to sendup the school's strict dress code in a creative way.
